pages.text: $(sol)I have made a breakthrough that will almost certainly help with my survival: a cheap, sturdy, and workable material I am calling 'andesite alloy'.$(br2)I believe it has a plethora of applications, which could lead to more progress, but I'm getting ahead of myself.
$(sol)Shaping this material into a sort of 'shaft' makes for a sturdy and relatively lightweight object. It seems mostly useless at first, but combining it with some wood shows much more promise.
$(sol)A combination of connected cogs and shafts lets me 'extend' rotational force I apply to them, and even change the speed. I have fashioned a crank to help with this.
$(sol)The next step would be to figure out a proper use for this, since just spinning these has little purpose outside of tiring myself out, but $(l)the possibilities I can think of are endless.
